title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8ยง 8.4 - Courses and examinations in public schools
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8ยง 8.4 - Courses and examinations in public schools

State Regulations
(a) The commissioner shall establish
regulations governing the following: (1)
approved courses of study in public schools; (2)
subjects in which Regents examinations
are given in such schools; (3)
the
method of rating answer papers; (4)
the credits to be allowed for subjects in which Regents examinations are not
regularly offered. (b) The amount of time devoted to required State assessments administered by or on
behalf of the State and developed by the State directly or by contract for each
grade shall not exceed, in the aggregate, one percent of the minimum required
annual instructional hours for such grade. Nothing in this subdivision shall be
construed to supersede the requirements of a section of the 504 plan of a
qualified student with disability or Federal law relating to English Language

Learners or the individualized education program of a students with
disabilities. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 8ยง
8.4

Amended, New

York State Register, Volume XXXVI, Issue 30, effective
7/30/2014

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
